channel.title: The New York Times Trends
channel.description: 用中文浏览纽约时报热门报道

item.title: Karine Jean-Pierre has been named White House press secretary. She will be the first Black woman and the first openly gay person to serve in the role. https://t.co/1HIvotvtM6 https://t.co/g8sXjiLGFW

Shell, Europe’s largest energy company, reported its biggest ever quarterly profit amid high oil and natural gas prices. The company recorded $9.1 billion in profit in the first three months of the year. https://t.co/k3leaF2Dbe

Ads account for roughly 90% of Twitter’s revenue. Numerous advertising executives say they’re willing to move their money elsewhere, especially if Elon Musk gets rid of the safeguards that allowed Twitter to remove racist rants and conspiracy theories. https://t.co/mT4gF9PIRb

A dramatic account of how the Oath Keepers leader, Stewart Rhodes, tried to reach Donald Trump on Jan. 6 with a message that the group could help keep him in power was revealed in federal court. https://t.co/G8MwFS78f1

Shawn Williams was just 19 when he was falsely accused of a 1993 murder in Brooklyn.
Now, after being freed in 2018, city officials will pay him $10.5 million to settle a federal civil rights suit against a former detective and two other officers. https://t.co/7bVmlTE5al
Breaking News: Nearly 15 million more people than expected died during the pandemic, the WHO said, far exceeding Covid tolls reported by countries. https://t.co/GpDiu2tizK

Elon Musk grew up in elite white communities in South Africa, detached from apartheid’s atrocities and surrounded by anti-Black propaganda.
He sees his takeover of Twitter as a free speech win but in his youth did not suffer the effects of misinformation. https://t.co/bciCJDWGGP
A growing number of White House Correspondents Dinner attendees have tested positive for Covid, including Secretary of State Antony Blinken. https://t.co/sadG6f9b0S
Breaking News: The Federal Reserve raised interest rates by half a percentage point, its largest move since 2000, as it tries to tame rapid inflation. https://t.co/o3jHahEjt1

Gov. Gavin Newsom vowed to protect the right to abortion in California and issued an impassioned “wake-up call” to the Democratic Party about what he described as a coordinated Republican-led effort to erode rights. https://t.co/vcl8TZEoF9
Breaking News: The U.S. has provided intelligence that has helped Ukraine target and kill many Russian generals who have died in the war, officials said. https://t.co/QwzcL9B7Yd

The resistance to Russia’s invasion will rank as “Ukraine’s finest hour,” Prime Minister Boris Johnson of Britain said, invoking Winston Churchill, in the first address by a foreign leader to the Ukrainian Parliament since the war began. https://t.co/ywLnjL2w4u https://t.co/QIw84itW2d

Germany will offer visas and job opportunities to Russians seeking to get away from Vladimir Putin’s government, the German economy minister said, describing measures similar to those Berlin has laid out for Ukrainian refugees. https://t.co/YGVy5VmCjw

Young children who transition to a new gender with social changes — taking on new names, pronouns and clothing — are likely to continue identifying as that gender five years later, according to a report. Participants transitioned, on average, at age 6.5. https://t.co/ywsKaYvGn5

Bolivian river dolphins were photographed with an anaconda in their mouths in August 2021. The aroused males could have been having a sexual romp with each other before the snake became entangled. https://t.co/wOyrIe6CUL https://t.co/tADtnIbPWv

The man who tackled Dave Chappelle onstage during his standup act at the Hollywood Bowl was armed with a fake gun that contained a blade, according to the police. He was charged with assault with a deadly weapon, the Los Angeles Police Department said. https://t.co/apiEwU3Qcq

The next round of sanctions against Russia will include Patriarch Kirill of Moscow over his support of the Kremlin's invasion of Ukraine, according to diplomats who reviewed the document but were not authorized to speak publicly. https://t.co/fJxqE2y3P8

Dolly Parton was voted into the Rock & Roll Hall of Fame, though she had asked not to be included, as were Eminem, Lionel Richie, Carly Simon, Eurythmics, Duran Duran and Pat Benatar. https://t.co/2mGKVbrcFt https://t.co/Kj5pHzt2TB

The comedian Dave Chappelle was tackled onstage as he performed at the Hollywood Bowl in Los Angeles, according to witnesses and videos. Footage circulating on social media appeared to show a man charging into Chappelle. https://t.co/hwlbL2T5Ej

Breaking News: Stanford University will receive a record $1.1 billion gift from the venture capitalist John Doerr to fund a school focused on climate change and sustainability. https://t.co/HIzxTTHXbs

Three survivors of the 1921 massacre that saw a white mob kill hundreds of Black residents in Tulsa can proceed with part of a lawsuit seeking reparations, an Oklahoma judge ruled. “History was made today,” a lawyer for the plaintiffs said. https://t.co/2WAbR82iNx
Thousands of abortion rights supporters protested across the U.S. after a draft ruling showed a majority of Supreme Court justices would vote to overturn Roe v. Wade. https://t.co/5BiyxSWUN1

Breaking News: Dolly Parton was voted into the Rock & Roll Hall of Fame, though she had asked not to be included, as were Eminem, Lionel Richie, Carly Simon, Eurythmics, Duran Duran and Pat Benatar. https://t.co/tHM8hdMmph

Breaking News: The EU proposed a total ban on Russian oil, its biggest step toward supporting Ukraine and reducing reliance on Russia.
Follow our live updates on the war. https://t.co/diw3GSxJ2n

Maxwell Berry, a 23-year-old Ohio man who the authorities say groped two flight attendants and punched a third before being duct-taped to his seat amid jeers from his fellow passengers on a flight last summer, was sentenced on Tuesday to 60 days in jail. https://t.co/uNdwu2Wx1N

Senator Lisa Murkowski, a centrist Republican, called the leak of a draft opinion on Roe v. Wade "absolutely reprehensible." But, she added, if the decision goes in the direction that the draft indicates, "it rocks my confidence in the court right now." https://t.co/DtsO2feuIQ https://t.co/LkciYToBQl

Gov. Ron DeSantis of Florida, who recently signed into law a ban on abortion after 15 weeks of pregnancy, described the leak of the draft Supreme Court opinion on abortion as an attack on the justices. "That’s a judicial insurrection," he said. https://t.co/nav7mF37sr

Hundreds of demonstrators gathered at Foley Square in Lower Manhattan on Tuesday evening to protest the possibility of the Supreme Court’s overturning Roe v. Wade, which has guaranteed the right to abortion for nearly half a century. https://t.co/ACFdFI2Vyd https://t.co/O6R1f7E66L

Thirteen states in the U.S. have so-called trigger laws, which would effectively ban abortions almost immediately after a decision from the Supreme Court to overturn Roe v. Wade. https://t.co/VzsPXHcQWq https://t.co/U1gGjA35OU

“This is my third war,” said Raisa Nazarchuk, 84, at a shelter in Lviv, Ukraine, on Tuesday. “Do you know when it will be over?”
A child in World War II, she also survived the war with Russian-backed separatist forces that broke out in 2014. https://t.co/nZEtSDyQQ3 https://t.co/de23JKWWo0

A warehouse of a Russian textbook company, whose chairman is a close friend of President Vladimir Putin, went up in flames overnight.
The blaze is another in a series of suspicious fires that have erupted across the country. https://t.co/bKykUQGmZL

"Our children will have less rights than their parents." Senator Chuck Schumer denounced the Supreme Court’s draft decision to overturn Roe v. Wade, saying it would be "one of the worst, most damaging decisions in modern history." https://t.co/Zht7aAjyGe https://t.co/sgyay2Cgo9

President Biden said the leaked draft of a Supreme Court ruling poised to reverse Roe v. Wade, if finalized, could undermine rights beyond abortion, including same-sex marriage. https://t.co/pvnWFdDn5J https://t.co/7U2Ab2735K

About half of the states are expected to ban abortion or enact limits on the procedure if the Supreme Court overturns Roe v. Wade, as a leaked draft opinion indicates the court has privately voted to do. See what could happen in those states. https://t.co/vBU2UqSLSG

Sen. Mitch McConnell called for a criminal investigation and charges against whoever leaked the draft Supreme Court opinion overturning Roe v. Wade, escalating conservatives’ effort to focus public attention on the leak itself rather than its substance. https://t.co/5nIutqMOXq https://t.co/SMnu0k3Aue

While cautioning the decision isn’t final until the Supreme Court announces its opinion, Senator Susan Collins, a Republican, said the draft ruling does not align with conversations she had with two Trump-appointed justices she voted to confirm. https://t.co/ws8kOVxSSe https://t.co/Scv283DQNh
The typical abortion patient in the U.S. already has a child, is poor, is unmarried and in her late 20s, has some college education and is very early in pregnancy. https://t.co/3j6kgrfweN

“The Republican-appointed justices’ reported votes to overturn Roe v. Wade would go down as an abomination, one of the worst, most damaging decisions in modern history,” Senator Chuck Schumer, Democrat of New York and the majority leader, said on Tuesday. https://t.co/6V3pWhGChE https://t.co/3jLdBNQQlg

Elon Musk often acts on impulse and the certainty that he is 100% right, according to interviews with those who have worked with him. He has constructed an insular world of about 10 confidants who mostly agree with him and carry out his bidding. https://t.co/0XF7GtV6lV

Progressive lawmakers across Europe reacted with concern and surprise to the news that the U.S. Supreme Court might overturn Roe v. Wade.
“The right of women to decide what happens to our own bodies is a human right,” the first minister of Scotland said. https://t.co/LydVWSGG5e

The Supreme Court legalized abortion in the U.S. with its ruling on Roe v. Wade in 1973. Nearly 50 years later, the court privately voted to strike down the decision, a leaked draft opinion shows.
Here’s what to know about the case. https://t.co/YdkVrva7Ik
Cardi B and Donatella Versace arrive at the #MetGala. Cardi's Versace dress is made from almost a kilometer of chains and jewelry. https://t.co/5bHYEkkuG9 https://t.co/i9MpElEMWU
Kim Kardashian and Pete Davidson arrive at the #MetGala. https://t.co/ofGBWfM1eB https://t.co/ogbabmSfg3

Progressive lawmakers across Europe expressed concerns and surprise that the U.S. Supreme Court had privately voted to strike down Roe v. Wade.
“It would be a terrible regression for American women,” one French senator said. https://t.co/V9P9XqoaKw

“Ending legal abortion will not end abortion,” said Cecile Richards, a former president of Planned Parenthood. “It simply will mean that women are no longer safe in this country.” https://t.co/rdNlOHfK1R

In the immediate aftermath of a leaked draft opinion that suggests the U.S. Supreme Court will overturn Roe v. Wade, supporters of abortion rights emphasized that the procedure was still legal — but under serious threat. https://t.co/bc7Oo6M9IV https://t.co/afnNsVONUe

Abortion would remain legal in about half of U.S. states if Roe v. Wade was overturned, but the rest would likely ban the procedure.
The number of abortions would probably fall, particularly among poor women in the South and Midwest. https://t.co/SRRRHYVDVe

Protesters flocked to the U.S. Supreme Court after reports emerged that a majority of justices had voted to strike down Roe v. Wade. The mood outside the court was a mix of anger and mourning. Some demonstrators shouted defiant chants; others sat silently. https://t.co/iGqgpFyiec https://t.co/ZqXsRPSgHr

Breaking News: A Philadelphia police officer who was fired after he fatally shot a 12-year-old boy in the back in March has been charged with murder in connection with the shooting, the authorities said Monday. https://t.co/iQDD8G3zUS

From December 2021: The typical abortion patient in the U.S. already has a child, is poor, is unmarried and in her late 20s, has some college education and is very early in pregnancy. https://t.co/qedBy7bhKo
